prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letter and Miscellany of James Branch Cabell, Accession #5298-ab, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased on 1998 February 5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter to Louise Collier Willcox, Cabell writes that he has inscribed a copy of The High Placefor her, will read her translation of My Friend from Limousin,and comments that the use of the word "loan" as a verb dates back to Shakespeare's Henry VIII.

did.unittitle: Letter from James Branch Cabell, Dumbarton, Virginia, to Louise Collier Willcox 1924 Jan 18

scopecontent.p: Sends her an appropriately inscribed copy of The High Place, has put aside My Friend from Limousinby Jean Giraudoux (translated by Willcox) to be read next week, and discusses the etymology of loan as a verb.

did.unittitle: Typed biographical summary about James Branch Cabell n.d.
Two black & white pictures of James Branch Cabell, one mentioning The High Placen.d.
